misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/aery.title: Aeryn-Vox
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/aery.description: Domains: Knowledge, Secrets, Prophecy, Magic Symbol: An open eye surrounded by a radiant sunburst She is the god of knowledge believed to have been the one who sent the astral libraries crashing down onto the elven planet of Aellalone, allowing them to create spaceflight and reach her domain in the sun. Her symbols are found in the silent libraries that dot the cosmos—guarded data-temples which float in quiet orbits, waiting to be found. The Voquari Ascendancy is actively searching for her prophesied scion, believing her will shall manifest the strongest of the living gods.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/drav.title: Drav'kyn
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/drav.description:
Domains: Communication, Language, Silence, Exile
Symbol: A broken mask with a beam of light emerging from the mouth
Synopsis: Drav’kyn is the god of speech, miscommunication, and the power of language. Once said to be whole, their face was broken and their tongue cracked, scattering different speech across species and stars. Now, their worship splits between two sects—those who seek to unify language (universal translators, diplomats), and those who revere silence as the true divine expression (monastic orders who speak only through coded light or gesture). Their followers are called to check into abandoned relay stations, where broken signals still echo believing it may be their voice still lingering.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/elia.title: Eliathe
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/elia.description:
Domains: Dreams, Mind, Emotion, Illusion
Symbol: A nebula shaped like a sleeping face
Synopsis: Eliathe is the goddess of dreams, the subconscious, and simulated realities. It is believed that her dreams shape remembrance streams themselves, and that lucid dreamers walk paths she carves through space. According to her followers it is through her thread that the galaxies may be connected in a harmonious fashion forming a neural network structure across galaxies. Her worshippers hold dreamfasting rituals, where they enter group simulations to commune with each other and her.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/ithe.title: Ithex
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/ithe.description:
Domains: Earth, Memory, Binding, Ancients
Symbol: A cracked stone disc carved with a spiral maze
Synopsis: Ithex is the god of buried truths and forgotten power—an ageless force revered before language, was founded by any spacefaring group known today. Their worship lingers in deep ruins and untranslatable glyphs, called upon by those who seek what was never meant to be found. No digital record of Ithex remains intact—their symbol corrupts files leaving only the physical.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/kael.title: Kael’Zar
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/kael.description:
Domains: Technology, Forge, Innovation, Craft
Symbol: A segmented gauntlet made of a circuit core
Synopsis: Kael’Zar is the god of invention and cosmic craft, worshipped by machinists, weaponwrights, and builders of starships and megastructures. Her flame is said to burn at the heart of neutron stars, and her most devoted followers rest in forge-temples orbiting black holes, where time bends to perfect the divine craft observing the flow of her progress in still time.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/kely.title: Kelyx
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/kely.description:
Domains: Time, Fate, Duality, Entropy, Lost Realities
Symbol: Two eclipsing moons spiraling in opposite directions
Synopsis: Kelyx represents the paradox of time and twin natures. Depicted as both a brother-sister pair and a singular entity, Kelyx is invoked in rituals involving fate manipulation, time travel, or alternate realities. Worshippers believe the god exists in all possible futures simultaneously, and cults have formed around opposing “halves” of Kelyx, each claiming a different cosmic destiny. One teaching is that all realities happen, it’s just a matter of which reality Kelyx drags your conscious to.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/myrr.title: Myrrhex
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/myrr.description:
Domains: Chaos, Creation, Nature, Space
Symbol: A spiral galaxy curled within a blooming flower
Synopsis: Myrrhex is the primordial architect of wild creation — the womb of stars and the seed of galaxies. She is not just a goddess of nature, but of unshaped matter, cosmic chaos, and violent, blooming genesis. Systems disappearing from the sky and reappearing color shifted and full of life when traveled too despite no sign of life before the disappearance. She is believed to be the goddess of the Vesk homeworld, there they pray not for gifts from her but that they may survive her creation.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/n’zh.title: N’Zhereth
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/n’zh.description:
Domains: Death, Darkness, Endings, Void
Symbol: A black ring devouring a field of stars
Synopsis: N’Zhereth is the god of endings, loss, and the cold hunger of space. He is a necessary god though not loved by many; all temples contain a corner to him. Necromancers and Psychopomps alike invoke his name in the stillness between stars. It is whispered that N’Zhereth devours ascenders who falter, and that the silence of deep space is his voice. He has no demi planes—only echoes, tombs, and the void.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/quor.title: Quorrax
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/quor.description: Domains: Desire, Ambition, Addiction, Secrets Symbol: A closed eye with a swirling galaxy inside Synopsis: Quorrax is the patron of unchecked desire—power, knowledge, sensation. They whisper temptations into the ears of travelers. Followers often implant subdermal “hunger glyphs” that pulse when near something they deeply crave. While some see them as a necessary god—driving exploration and progress—others view them as a corrupting force. Following the arrival of the Hekath, open worship of Quorrax has become extremely uncommon, many religious believe that the Hekath are a plague created by Quorrax as the ultimate evolution of consumption.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/sole.title: Solenne
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/sole.description:
Domains: Light, Healing, Sun, Ascension
Symbol: A radiant sun encircled by three golden rings
Synopsis: Solenne is the solar goddess of light and transcendence, worshipped by healers, mystics, and Solarian monks. Her clergy believe the soul ascends through cycles of radiant suffering and cosmic enlightenment. Pilgrims seek her grace through sun-walks—ritual spaceflights close to solar stellar bodies. Though technology exists to cover scars many of her followers wear their scars with pride to show the blessings of life that she bestowed upon them in the time of need.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/tare.title: Tarellon
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/tare.description:
Domains: Community, Cities, Architecture, Stability
Symbol: A hexagonal city seen from above, with a central glowing spire
Synopsis: Tarellon is the god of foundations—of cities raised from dust, alliances forged in stone, and the unseen bonds that hold societies together. They are worshipped by urban planners, governors, and homesteaders who see civilization not as conquest, but as cooperation. The winds that howl through forgotten cities are said to be Tarellon mourning what could have been.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/thar.title: Tharos
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/thar.description: Domains: War, Law, Protection, Authority Symbol: A flaming sword over a constellation of a warrior (The constellation changes based on location) Synopsis: Tharos is the god of law and battle, revered by soldiers and planetary governors alike. His worship spread after the fall of the Vasen Empire, whose legions claimed to fight under his gaze. Though all that remains of that empire are the war machines, the calculating robots still chant his prayers. His temples are fortress-monasteries, where verdicts are as sacred as oaths. Tharos teaches that war must serve order, not chaos, and his clergy often act as enforcers in warzones and failed colonies. Some claim he once walked among the Vesk during their first interstellar conquests.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/vel’.title: Vel’Taro
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/vel’.description:
Domains: Beauty, Passion, Alcohol, Celebration
Symbol: A jeweled goblet overflowing with starlight
Synopsis: Vel’Taro is the god of indulgence, artistry, and divine intoxication, worshipped in taverns, theaters, and celebration halls across the stars. His faithful believe joy is sacred, and that beauty, drink, and love are the highest forms of worship. Followers track where he is through spilled sacred alcohol in zero gravity, tracking its flow.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/veyr.title: Veyra
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/veyr.description:
Domains: Nature, Mutation, Life, Evolution
Symbol: A spiraling vine with crystalline blossoms
Synopsis: Veyra is the goddess of growth, mutation, and adaptation. She is honored in bio-engineering labs and jungle moons alike. Her worshippers believe life must change or perish, and embrace augmentation, symbiosis, and controlled mutation. She has strange temples grown from seed-vaults and bloom into massive organic cathedrals. Many uplifted species and altered creatures owe their lineage to her faithful, who see genetic change not as corruption—but as sacred revelation.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/xala.title: Xalaith
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/xala.description: Domains: Pain, Resilience, Sacrifice, Rebirth Symbol: A thorned spine wrapped around a glowing heart Synopsis: Xalaith teaches that pain is the price of becoming, and only through endurance can transcendence be found. She is revered in conflict zones, hospice ships, and planetary refuges. Her followers believe that scars are holy glyphs and that every wound is a gateway to metamorphosis. Her sect sometimes clashes with Solenne’s, believing suffering is not to be healed, but embraced.

misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/zarn.title: Zarn
misc/gods/gods-of-concord-of-aedryn/zarn.description:
Domains: Travel, Trade, Luck, Portals
Symbol: A three-fingered hand offering a stargate
Synopsis: Zarn is the god of gambles and deals made at the edge of reason. He is worshipped in remembrance observation stations and deep-space trade hubs, where his shrines serve as both altars and marketplaces. Legend says he once sold the first remembrance stream to a mortal, and he continues to barter secrets for devotion. His field clerics often double as traders, smugglers, or gambler.

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Ashen Veil
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description:
The Ashen Veil
Domains: Memory, Grief, Defiance, Identity
Symbol: A folded banner wrapped in black thread, faintly stained with soot
Synopsis: The Ashen Veil is the residue of remembrance, the weight of names that should have faded but did not. It is not typically worshipped, only kept. A forbidden concept, it clings to erased history and burns quietly in those who refuse to forget. The Imperium calls it a fracture in unity; its keepers call it truth. Followers of the Ashen Veil believe that without knowing the past one cannot truly know the present.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Ashen Veil.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Emperor Ascendant
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description: Domains: Will, Order, Legacy, Unity Symbol: A crown floating above a shadowless flame Synopsis: Solaran Emperor is not immortal, nor remembered. Upon their death, each Emperor Spirit willingly enters the Silent Continuum, a metaphysical state where their name, face, and deeds begin to fade, not by forgetfulness, but by divine design. This unraveling is called the Unchaining, a sacred effect that severs the past from the present. Over time, even their statues blur, their voice erased from recordings, their commands reduced to principles without attribution. What remains is not legacy, but momentum, an empire freed from nostalgia, bound only to the will of the now. To resist this erasure is considered a spiritual fracture; to seek memory of a past Emperor is to fracture unity and is considered a great heresy in either case. In the Solaran view, the future must not be ruled by the dead.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Emperor Ascendant.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Hollow Chorus
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description:
Domains: Obedience, Silence, Devotion, Standardization
Symbol: An array of open mouths with no tongues
Synopsis: The Chorus speaks in unison, or not at all. It is the echo of doctrine passed perfectly through generations. Individual voice is distortion. Harmony is transmission. Where speech is synchronized, where movement is mirrored, the Chorus is present. It rewards those who vanish within it.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Hollow Chorus.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Living Throne
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description:
Domains: Variable (Defined by the Reigning Solaran Emperor) Symbol: A crown suspended above a mirrored flame
Synopsis: The Emperor is not a god, but the anchor of divine function. Upon coronation, their will reshapes the metaphysical structure of the Solara Imperium. Domains shift, an Emperor of conquest brings War and Dominion, one of reform ushers in Knowledge and Law. Clerics bound to the Living Throne feel this change as revelation; their rites, miracles, and even their purpose realign overnight. The Empire does not worship the Emperor's person, but their current truth. When the Emperor dies, their influence is erased by the Unchaining. Only the present ruler defines the sacred rites of the Imperium.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Living Throne.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Pulse Unending
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description: Domains: Labor, Industry, Motion, Continuity Symbol: A heart wrapped in machinery, pistons rising where veins should be Synopsis: The Pulse is the living rhythm of the Solara Imperium’s industry. It drives the machines, the schedules, the cities themselves. Every factory ticks to its beat. Every worker moves in its tempo. To resist the Pulse is to slow the machine; to slow the machine is to threaten the future. Progress is breathless, tireless, endless, and so must those in it be. Those who are attuned to the technology of the Imperium are considered blessed, for they can hear the heart thump with the Solaran Emperors divine command.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Pulse Unending.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Quiet Forge
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description: Domains: Innovation, Discipline, Knowledge, Precision Symbol: A still anvil split by a beam of cold light Synopsis: The Quiet Forge is not a place but a principle: that discovery without restraint is ruin. In the Solara Imperium, knowledge is tempered, not pursued. Scientists work in silence, shaping advancement with careful hands. They do not seek recognition. They deliver miracles because the Imperium requires them, and because the Solaran Emperor spoke them into being.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Quiet Forge.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Silent Flow
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description: Domains: Nature, Cycles, Survival, Subordination Symbol: A spiral of flowing lines, like water or wind Synopsis: The Silent Flow is the reverence of countless lesser spirits, rivers, storms, roots, and stones, each with its own quiet will. They are not gods, but presences, honored in gestures and rituals passed down in silence. Within the Solara Imperium, they endured, but not defied, nature made obedient. But beneath that obedience, the Flow remembers a time when it was not silent.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Silent Flow.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Steel Spire
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description: Domains: Sacrifice, Empire, Discipline, Immortality Symbol: An upward-reaching tower formed from entwined blades and bones Synopsis: The closest thing the Solara Imperium has to a god, the Steel Spire is not a being, but a structure of spiritual resonance, its base forged from the blades of fallen heroes, its peak unseen, always reaching. Every citizen contributes to its metaphorical height by fulfilling their role in the Imperium. The Spire is said to "record" the heat of martyrdom, hard work, and servitude and transform it into divine permanence. In ritual, names of the fallen are engraved into alloy tablets, sealed in vaults near the emperor that ring like bells when war draws near.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Steel Spire.md

misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.title: The Vessel of Intent
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.description: Domains: Purpose, Caste, Identity, Constraint Symbol: A sealed crucible stamped with an unknown sigil Synopsis: Within the Solara Imperium, purpose is not chosen—it is poured. The Vessel of Intent defines every citizen’s role at birth, not as limitation, but as clarity. To question one's function is to fracture the whole. Reassignment is rare, failure is returned to the crucible. You are what you are made to be—and nothing more. In this, there is peace.
misc/gods/gods-of-the-solara-imperium/th.sourcePath: Misc/Gods/Gods of the Solara Imperium/The Vessel of Intent.md

misc/gods/miunctios.html.title: Miunctios
misc/gods/miunctios.html.description: A cult belief in the ascension of the mind through micro digitization, the most popular form of practice involves using credits' ability to mimic organic life to replace cells in the body turning the person inorganic overtime, though a fully completed version has yet to be documented. In most forms of Miunctios the body is left behind after the attempted process and the now digitized soul/mind would be free to wander the virtual paradise. There are internal conflicts in the religion of the holiness of androids/souled AIs, as some view them as divine messengers and others as traitors who have returned to the world of the physical after a successful ascension.

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/a.title: Aetherion Corporation
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/a.description:
Quote Wealth is wisdom, trade is destiny, and power is eternal. — High Ledger-Keeper Vorric Dain The Aetherion Corporation is a vast corporate-theocratic empire, where capital is law, trade is the highest virtue, and economic mastery is the ultimate form of conquest.
Rising from the corporations that pioneered space flight on the dwarven planet of Khaldorr Prime, it used its monopoly on space flight in order to dictate the expansion of civilization itself, not through war but by owning the very means of reaching the stars. In order to keep the planets under them from breaking contract, the Corporation decentralizes at least one necessary resource for survival from any settlement. The only ships allowed to deliver that resource to the settlement are officially sanctioned Aetherion Corporation ships.

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/c.title: Concord of Aedryn
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/c.description:
Quote Some call it stagnation. I call it stability. Progress is nothing without a foundation to stand on, and we have built the most prosperous foundation in the known galaxy. President Arlen Vaest The largest of the empires, it is a federal republic where prosperity and unity mask the slow creep of bureaucracy, corporate influence, and political inertia.
Founded on the prosperous but undiscovered world of Aedryn (Planet), the Concord of Aedryn was formed through Aedryn Accords, a unification of war-torn planetary states seeking stability through trade and mutual defense. Rapid expansion followed, integrating worlds through diplomacy and economic incentives, though corporate interests soon entrenched themselves in governance. While it remains one of the wealthiest, largest, and most advanced civilizations, political stagnation and corporate overreach have begun to erode its ideals.Major Gods:
Aeryn-Vox
Drav'kyn
Eliathe
Ithex
Kael’Zar
Kelyx
Myrrhex
N’Zhereth
Quorrax
Solenne
Tarellon
Tharos
Vel’Taro
Veyra
Xalaith
Zarn

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/h.title: Hekath
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/h.description: Quote They are not a swarm. A swarm is mindless. They are not a plague. A plague does not choose. They are hunger made flesh, and they have already decided that we belong to them. - Grand Admiral Kethis Valorr Deadly Beasts dedicated to consuming anything that they come into contact with.The Hekath are a force of biological weapons keen on assimilation, seeking organic life only to consume and integrate it into themselves. They do not negotiate, take prisoners, or leave survivors, any being possessing DNA is killed on sight. Despite their mindless hunger, some androids have demonstrated the ability to communicate with them, though no clear motivation or purpose has ever been understood. Hekath remains reveal a truth of their nature, they do not simply devour, they evolve, incorporating the genetic traits of their prey into their own flesh. Their origins are unknown, the only current security is they do not invade in greater numbers.

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/h.title: Hollow Stars
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/h.description:
Quote You keep flying, you keep breathing. That's all that matters. – Ranger Saria Vale
A loose confederation of planets and solar systems at the edge of the Solara Imperium, the Concord of Aedryn, and the Aetherion Corporation.Founded during the grand expansion of those empires as a collection of free worlds attempting to retain self-autonomy, the hollow stars confederation technically has no central authority, with each planet/ecosystem providing representatives that allow negotiations between each internal government. There are some hard-set rules that all planets in the Hollow Stars need to agree with in order to be a member of the confederation. The planet must not block trade with any other planet within the confederation, the planet must allow Rangers from other planets in the confederation to hunt down criminals that fled the original planet, if one planet is attacked by an outside government body all planets must provide aid in whatever way they can to stop the whole confederacy from falling, the internal government must not recognize itself as part of a larger non-Hallow Star government

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/r.title: Reimap
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/r.description:
Quote
You perceive time as a river. We knew it as an ocean. Now, we float in your stream, stranded in a current we did not choose. – Received transmission from a molten planet
A formerly shapeless dimensionally reduced people, found in the folds of space they are kind but impossible to understand without training. When a foreign object entered their dimension, it introduced chaos forcing them to flee as the reality crumpled resulting in them fleeing to the corners of our system. They reside within odd places in space which are inhospitable to natives of the plane but are composed of relative pure mathematics with minimal stochastic effects to account for.

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/s.title: Scarlet Dominion
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/s.description: Quote What is freedom but the luxury of decay? Kneel, and I will grant you eternity. - Archfiend Veltharion A hellish empire from the far reaches of space, bringing devils into the world and allowing them to take souls back to the devils’ home dimension. Their queen feared entropy and the blotting of her sun, in desperate bid she contacted the hellish planes. The solar system was thus transformed into an infernal manifestation on the material plane halting much of the stochastic processes from the blotting of the sun to biological evolution, ensuring all things followed the hellish laws. Though small the empire has managed to claim 3 entire solar systems for itself and send out operatives to tempt souls to bolster their ranks and expand the empire.

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/s.title: Solara Imperium
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/s.description:
Quote The stars belong to those who live, struggle, and die. Not to timeless, unchanging despots who fear death and deny progress. - Emperor Khael The emperor of man stands for the mortals, as a manifest dominion decree they state the stars belong to man not the unfeeling immortals.
The imperium was founded following the chaos of the Immortal Wars on the human home world. For centuries, the human home world and its colonies were ruled by cold, deathless tyrants, their decrees enforced by soulless constructs and cloned enforcers, who themselves never knew death. Thus the solar throne was formed as a war machine breaking the hold immortals had over them, it now views itself as the true inheritor of the cosmos for it was mankind alone who shattered the chains of eternity and reclaimed their right to rule. The Imperium marches forward into the stars, for to halt is to become like the stagnant immortals that claimed humanity before."Gods:"
The Ashen Veil
The Emperor Ascendant
The Hollow Chorus
The Living Throne
The Pulse Unending
The Quiet Forge
The Silent Flow
The Steel Spire
The Vessel of Intent

misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/v.title: Voquari Ascendancy
misc/groups/empires-and-confederations/v.description: Quote From dust, we carve divinity. From chaos, we sculpt the eternal. The Ascendancy does not conquer—it reclaims what was lost. - High Celestarch Vaelos A gilded empire of eternal rulers, obsessed with celestial ascension.The ascendency finds candidates on worlds who are ready to become celestial Solars, those Solars are then given control of the planet and allowed to transform it along with with their own celestial edicts, sculpting it into a fragment of the heavens that were lost when mortals first reached beyond the sky. In this way, the Ascendancy does not merely rule—it seeks to rebuild paradise itself, one world at a time.

misc/asphalt-mystics.html.title: Asphalt Mystics
misc/asphalt-mystics.html.description: The magic of reading travelers who have driven over roads and through reading the collective movements of people they may divine truths over the universe. Colloquially known as pothole saints.

misc/awakening.html.title: Awakening
misc/awakening.html.description: a term given for magic powers becoming innate in someone with no/little magic powers. It appears to be caused by stress and the power appears as an alleviator of said stress. Not observed in objects as shown by the Object Stressor Experiments that were leaked in the Concord of Aedryn.

misc/cultivation.html.title: Cultivation
misc/cultivation.html.description: refining ones body, mind, and spiritual energy to ascend to a higher realm or gain power. Often the result of intense meditation, energy circulation, and visualization enhanced by Stressors, philosophical realizations, and spiritual enlightenment. It is an old tradition that faded from public consciousness in favor of technology and magic, though recently anyone can become a cultivator by buying the Ascendant package from Aetherion Corporation available in Core, Nascent Ascendant, and Immortal tiers.

misc/doctorinecasting.html.title: Doctorinecasting
misc/doctorinecasting.html.description: A form of magic where the user of immense conviction is able to bend reality so long as they truly believe it. The use of which can forge or dissolve metaphysical laws for brief moments in their vicinity. Belief must be total, doubt is fatal. Typically accompanied by confirmers, a group of people with belief or altered memory that affirm the belief allowing small leniency on the part of the caster. Very powerful but high risk, can cause Schismatic Implosions resulting in the user imploding both physically and spiritually or in Ideophantasms when they die where the belief continues to walk long after the user has died.the Solaran Emperor is believed to be one due to one advisor who was found dead claimed they were able to manifest the will of his people seemingly into production towards their goal. Though this is debated as it was a piece of information traded for asylum.Most Major factions use them in order to achieve the impossible for smaller factions and some cult leaders are said to have used it. Though sadly failing to hold the doctrine erases memory of you so there are more that you should know but dont due to that.Technically some believe the first Contemplative was one but again they're hard to verify as skeptics can usually claim it was something else unless they erased themselves in which case they aren't remembered

misc/echoforging.html.title: Echoforging
misc/echoforging.html.description: A magic that is done by doing a task meticulously the same for a stretch of time such that one day, the man becomes unnecessary and the action happens on its own. Hammers forge and vials fill themselves. Was the primary mode of factories before the invention of robotics.

misc/liturgical-communion.html.title: Liturgical Communion
misc/liturgical-communion.html.description: The process developed by monks of Aeryn-Vox during a siege where food ran thin, of eating a book page by page after reading it, a manner of ritual is preformed during the reading (secret to those outside of practicing orders) that causes the book to bind with the person allowing words to form upon their skin said to be divine revelation to those who can interpret it. In combative orders, the monks then take the empty covers of the books and convert them into magazines so that the connection between the monk and book may fuel the bullets with their magics. People with tattoos depicting words are asked to cover them up in the presence of peaceful orders and attacked on sight by the non peaceful orders.

misc/possible-misinformation.html.title: Possible Misinformation
misc/possible-misinformation.html.description:
Rememberance Streams aren't really a thing instead they disassemble and reassemble you at the location after an allotted time thus explaining why complex machinery and people have slight discrepancies when they go through them. Voting is decided by a learning algorithm in order to get the best results of an election, the data is then fabricated in reverse from its output in order to ensure this happens. Androids don't actually dream, governments have them transmit data to them and sometimes those transmissions get scrambled and are interpreted as dreams by the androids.,
#Vesk culture is a LARP they created to seem cooler when they met other spacefaring ancestries,
Hekath are a hoax by major powers in order to keep people scared of outsiders/maintain military control,
The emperor is an everchanging immortal that killed all others of their kind in order to reign supreme. Life signs on new planets are faked in order to get funding., Mortality was not originally from this plane of existence, since souls are immortal.,
The Aetherion Corporation already has immortality ready to give to people, but is selling it in incremental packages known as healthcare., Clones are used to replace influencers when they get too disobedient., The gods have no physical body and thus are using mortals to prototype a form of physical body that would be perfect for them, evolution is the means to produce this body.,
The Infosphere is actually real time, the government keeps it on a delay though to allow censoring of broadcasts they don't like., Undead is the final form of evolution since as others like humanity and even immortals decay, they stay the same., Corporate drones are legally mandated to miss a certain amount of shots to avoid lawsuits.

misc/technomancy.html.title: Technomancy
misc/technomancy.html.description: the ability to sense and manipulate technology. Individuals with it can typically sense the presence of signals and with practice interpret them without the use of assistant technology. The standard spell focus for one is a signal interpreter that converts the tech manipulation of a technomancer into raw physical magic. Technomancers typically experience extreme psychological hardship when removed from a system with signal noise too long much like a nontechnomancer put into a sensory deprivation chamber and thus many carry small signal noise generators in order to combat this when going to systems with no internet.

misc/threadbinding.html.title: Threadbinding
misc/threadbinding.html.description: The use of a shared craft allow two people to induce a sympathetic bond, sensing emotions from a short distance even in the absence of technology or magic.

misc/tricaelus-conflict.html.title: Tricaelus Conflict
misc/tricaelus-conflict.html.description: involved The Concord of Aedryn, Solara Imperium, and The Aetherion Corporation, which was the last standardized decade ago fought over the Vorrakis System, Nyx-Cadion System, Zelthar System, Orphos-9 System, Tiraxis System, and Ephraem’s Reach. The war was brutal fracturing the borders of each empire resulting in a stalemate, great support for abandoned solar systems to the Hollow Star Collective, and the expansion agreement. Where the empires can only expand at a shared rate with the other two, failure to expand at a similar rate will be taken as a declaration of war by the two non expanders.

misc/vacuum-rites.html.title: Vacuum Rites
misc/vacuum-rites.html.description: A series of rites done outside of the safety of a spaceship in the vacuum can take many forms. The most common of which is to do so on the darkside of a planet absent a moon in order to be able to manifest void and remove properties from objects and creatures. The most common of which tend to be the Right of Lightless Lungs which allow one to survive for 3 days between breaths. Others that allow users to remove things such as gravity, physical interaction, and the need to speak to cast.

npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/ko.title: Ko
npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/ko.description:
Siryu's cousin
They were bubbly and easy to get along with, but didn’t seem fit for constant space travel and decided to settle down in the next big port that they stopped at. At one point, ASPER offered to bring them into their bond, but they shut that down without hesitation.

npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/na.title: Naeri Astana
npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/na.description:
(She/her, 41y/o, alive) - A lashunta diplomat with connections to the Concord of Aedryn and follower of Drav'kyn. She was close with Shujiao before her cultivation accident, and took her in when she expressed her wish to leave. During the renewal period, Naeri grew increasingly worried about the state of Shujiao's body and attempted to get assistance in repairing it, but very little could be done beyond making sure that the deterioration didn't worsen. When ASPER took over the body, she was relieved and did her best to fill them in on any questions that they might have. To her surprise, they took quick interest in Aeryn-Vox without any prompting from her, so she very tentatively took them back to the Song Tian Temple that Shujiao lived for the majority of her life.
- After about a yearish there, ASPER got her to take them back with her on her ship after a disagreement between them and Velin Desat.
- She introduced them to Siryu. - Since then, the two of them have been working odd jobs here and there transporting goods under the radar for her.

npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/ra.title: Raz
npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/ra.description: The first loss of someone in their bond. ASPER was young and had made tentative ‘friends’ with a cultivator that kept in contact after they left the temple. Her name was Raz, a human who had grown up in the Temple. She was very quiet and kept to herself for the most part, but the two kept in communication despite it. One moment she was there, a constant in the bond, and the next, gone. ASPER quickly contacted Velin Desat, who revealed that Raz got caught up in a fire fight while out purchasing supplies and no one was there to help.

npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/sh.title: Shūjiǎo
npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/sh.description: (she/her, ~137 when passed the body along) - The old owner of ASPER's body, and a cleric of Aeryn-Vox. She was part of a group of cultivators (Sòng Tiān Temple) who were trying to bring about a new age of 'immortality' by integrating artificial beings into their practices. At some point before releasing her body, her cultivation caused a full body malfunction, changing her from a very kind and outspoken person into someone that became more reserved and ended up writing her thoughts down into several journals rather than speaking them aloud. She left the temple with Naeri Astana not long after, and then passed these journals along to her to give to the next owner of her body before she underwent renewal. During renewal, there was a 3 year period of time where no new soul entered, and the body began to break down further.

npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/si.title: Siryu
npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/si.description: (she/her, 22 y/o, alive) - A pahtra ship pilot. She's mostly known for running a beat up piece of garbage that she lovingly calls the Rusty Curiosity, but when she's working, it runs like a beauty. She specializes in working under the radar, which leads her to transporting things most people would raise an eyebrow to. She also takes on passengers for the right price. However, with the nature of her jobs, she needed someone to help her out, which led to Naeri Astana recommending ASPER to take up the job. What they didn't realize was that the job was basically just a smuggling gig, but they quickly adjusted once the confusion was cleared up.

npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/ve.title: Velin Desat
npcs/epitaph-protocol-npcs/asper-npcs/ve.description: (he/him, 340y/o, alive) - A blind vlaka who was raised within the temple and who has spent the past 20 years as sect leader of Song Tian Temple. He very briefly knew Shujiao before she left, so when ASPER returned, they were welcomed with open arms. However, ASPER quickly left barely a year later after a disagreement between them broke out over the purpose of cultivation; he believed that it is only when you ascend to immortality that you realize your true potential in the world, while ASPER felt that ascension was not necessary to achieve that. He has tried bringing them back after their argument, and even sent some cultivators after them, but ASPER did not want to go back. Despite this, they still keep him in their mystic bond. Relatively tense relationship between them.
aliases: Velin Desat of circle Song Tian Temple

pcs-(active)/asper.html.title: ASPER
pcs-(active)/asper.html.description:
Pinterest
Sheet (lvls 1-2)
Age: 18 Body age: 158 yearsSPOILERS TLDR: ASPER (they/them) Android mystic actively breaking down due to body malfunctions that have damaged their emotion processors
Body used to be owned by Shujiao (she/her), a cultivator + cleric of Aeryn-Vox Based on Shujiao’s writings, they have been trying to find a data-temple that might contain info on how to prevent continued deterioration Has been acting as a smuggler to slowly fund their way between worlds Who are you now? ASPER (they/them) Android mystic who is actively deteriorating Why are you the class you are? What drew you to this path instead of another? Instead of being drawn to Aeryn-Vox as a cleric, they felt more drawn to what she represents, rather than her as a divine being overall. What do you specialize in? Combat, science, mysticism, tech, diplomacy, etc.? mysticism, religion What are your personal edicts and anathemas? Describe a situation that might challenge or complicate those beliefs. Edicts: Patience and persistence in all things. Pursue the truth no matter what. Relentlessly document and interpret data. Anathemas: Fail to safeguard magical texts, artifacts or knowledge. Engage in overly unhealthy or self-destructive behaviors. Hold a grudge. If the information that needs to be documented could dramatically disrupt the lives of the people in their mystic bond. If it's choosing between those close to them over magical texts. If patience would backfire tremendously. What are your current goals? What do you want to change or preserve in the galaxy? They want to share the information locked away in the data temples; they believe that if she didn't want the temples to be sought after that she wouldn't have marked them with her symbols and left them as a sort of puzzle to find.
What circumstances led you to traveling through the fringes of space near the nominally Hollow Star planet of Kiliv-VI? Naeri actually contacted ASPER and suggested it based on information she received; she strongly implied that it would lead them in the right direction of a data temple without outright saying it. They “borrowed” Siryu’s ship in the meantime. How did you gain your class abilities? Formal training, private sector enhancement, military service, experimentation, accident, natural talent? Technically natural talent? It was more of a natural extension of learning about Shujiao; she became wholly devoted to Aeryn-Vox, and while they feel strongly connected to their shared god, they feel more attuned to what she represents rather than the goddess herself. Who were you before your current role or journey? A failed diplomat. They shadowed Naeri for a time being, but that was quickly shut down once their seemingly uncaring interactions caused tensions to rise and a few bullets shot. They were asked not to do that again. Are you aligned with any organizations? What did you do before joining up with that organization? What is your strongest memory from earlier in your life? Are there memories you’ve lost or that haunt you?
The first loss of someone in their bond. ASPER was young and had made tentative ‘friends’ with a cultivator that kept in contact after they left the temple. Her name was Raz, a human who had grown up in the temple. She was very quiet and kept to herself for the most part, but the two kept in communication despite it. One moment she was there, a constant in the bond, and the next, gone. ASPER quickly contacted Velin, who revealed that Raz got caught up in a fire fight while out purchasing supplies and no one was there to help. If your life had gone differently, what would you be doing now?
Entirely possibly they’d be back at the temple working with Velin. Potentially even becoming sect leader should they have properly pursued cultivation instead of learning the beliefs behind it and leaving with no proper practice. Where were you born or raised? Planet, station, habitat, ship, etc.?
Technically on Naeri’s ship, but also partially on the small planet of [insert name here] at the Sòng Tiān Temple. Most of their life has been spent on ships, however. Who were you closest to in your past?
For a while there was another person helping out Siryu: Siryu’s cousin, Ko. They were bubbly and easy to get along with, but didn’t seem fit for constant space travel and decided to settle down in the next big port that they stopped at. At one point, ASPER offered to bring them into their bond, but they shut that down without hesitation. Who did you consider your family—biological, adopted, and/or chosen? Naeri basically raised ASPER as a mother, teaching them how to be someone while also grieving Shujiao. Describe a moment or event that deeply shaped who you are now. After leaving Song Tian Temple, ASPER fell into a bit of a rut for a few years and struggled to figure out what to be doing. During this time, Naeri grew increasingly concerned and eventually brough out one of Shujiao’s journals and passed it along to them. They read through it and was completely fascinated with what they found there. Naeri hesitated for a while to give another, but when they saw how ASPER found a purpose with tracking what Shujiao did in life, she kept giving them book after book. There are still several that she hasn’t passed along from the end of Shujiao’s life that ASPER has been vying for for years. Name three NPCs from your past that you still think about. Are they alive? Where are they now?
(Bonus since important. lol) Shūjiǎo (书角) (she/her, ~137 when passed the body along) - The old owner of ASPER's body, and a cleric of Aeryn-Vox. She was part of a group of cultivators (Sòng Tiān (送天) Temple) who were trying to bring about a new age of 'immortality' by integrating artificial beings into their practices. At some point before releasing her body, her cultivation caused a full body malfunction, changing her from a very kind and outspoken person into someone that became more reserved and ended up writing her thoughts down into several journals rather than speaking them aloud. She left the temple with Naeri Astana not long after, and then passed these journals along to her to give to the next owner of her body before she underwent renewal. During renewal, there was a 3 year period of time where no new soul entered, and the body began to break down further.
Naeri Astana (She/her, 41y/o, alive) - A lashunta diplomat with connections to the Concord of Aedryn and follower of Drav'kyn. She was close with Shujiao before her cultivation accident, and took her in when she expressed her wish to leave. During the renewal period, Naeri grew increasingly worried about the state of Shujiao's body and attempted to get assistance in repairing it, but very little could be done beyond making sure that the deterioration didn't worsen. When ASPER took over the body, she was relieved and did her best to fill them in on any questions that they might have. To her surprise, they took quick interest in Aeryn-Vox without any prompting from her, so she very tentatively took them back to the temple that Shujiao lived for the majority of her life. After about a yearish there, ASPER got her to take them back with her on her ship after a disagreement between them and Velin. She introduced them to Siryu. Since then, the two of them have been working odd jobs here and there transporting goods under the radar for her.
Velin Desat (Velin Desat of circle Song Tian Temple) (he/him, 34y/o, alive) - A blind vlaka who was raised within the temple and who has spent the past 20 years as sect leader. He very briefly knew Shujiao before she left, so when ASPER returned, they were welcomed with open arms. However, ASPER quickly left barely a year later after a disagreement between them broke out over the purpose of cultivation; he believed that it is only when you ascend to immortality that you realize your true potential in the world, while ASPER felt that ascension was not necessary to achieve that. He has tried bringing them back after their argument, and even sent some cultivators after them, but ASPER did not want to go back. Despite this, they still keep him in their mystic bond. Relatively tense relationship between them.
Siryu (she/her, 22 y/o, alive) - A pahtra ship pilot. She's mostly known for running a beat up piece of garbage that she lovingly calls the Rusty Curiosity, but when she's working, it runs like a beauty. She specializes in working under the radar, which leads her to transporting things most people would raise an eyebrow to. She also takes on passengers for the right price. However, with the nature of her jobs, she needed someone to help her out, which led to Naeri recommending ASPER to take up the job. What they didn't realize was that the job was basically just a smuggling gig, but they quickly adjusted once the confusion was cleared up. Do you have any prior connection to any of the other PCs?
The 26 Laws of Power
Ended up being on the Rusty Curiosity for a time where ASPER sat down near them and kept asking questions. They’d get a response, they’d type it down, pause, and then ask another question. They didn't get to interact with many new people, so finding new information was welcomed regardless of who it came from. Mystic Bond - Up to 10 willing creatures; i always know general direction and HP totals, if concious/unconscious, dying, or dead. At 3rd, this also extends to other members of the bond with each other. Naeri Astana Velin Desat Siryu Party Member #1 Party Member #2 Party Member #3 Party Member #4 Party Member #5 Party Member #6 What themes or story arcs are you hoping to explore with this character? What it means to be religious despite the fact that they are an artificial being Dealing with those who recognize 'you' when their idea of who you are and who you are being two different things What kind of gameplay experience do you want mechanically? (e.g. utility, heavy hitter, problem solver, weird build) healer + utility As this is the flagship campaign in the new world how would you prefer technical terms be given out? maybe a basic "heres some things your characters would know" while the rest comes up naturally through questions during game and such. if i am understanding this correctly lmfao What are you hoping to see in this campaign? (Tone, themes, types of encounters or problems) Truth vs lies? Haunting the narrative? I’m kind of struggling to come up with an answer here What content or themes would you prefer not to be included? ideally avoiding explicit depiction of animal death would be good and hurting children This campaign will include themes of extortion/slavery, control, death, and post/transhumanism. Are there any specific types of loss or emotional beats (e.g. betrayal, body horror, loss of autonomy) that are off-limits for you? a heads up for specifically eye damage would be good, but otherwise i am good! There are some horrors innately related to space (e.g. loneliness, time distortion, etc) is there any special way you'd prefer I broach these topics? no! i'm good

info_showInlineTags.description: Show tags defined inside the document at the top of the page.

info_showFrontmatterTags.description: Show tags defined in the frontmatter of the document at the top of the page.

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_hideProperties.description: A list of properties to hide from the properties view

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_minCollapseDepth.description: Only allow outline items to be collapsed if they are at least this many levels deep in the tree.

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
